name: Hardest Skeleton Words 9 Trivia Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: TH (an American state)
SP (Greek author of fables)
CRPR (a person who deals cards and collects bets at a gaming table)
GND (African Republic)
RNC (a river in South America)
PPR (a person who is extremely poor)
NRB (an African capital city)
questions.explanation:
Nairobi & nairobi.

	The capital of Kenya.

questions.text: PRRT (a male character from French pantomime with a whitened face)
LRS (a full-bodied, golden-coloured, sweet sherry)
PS (religious, devout)
SN (a walled city in central Italy)
SC (in the Old Testament, the son of Abraham and the father of Jacob and Esau)
DLWSS (a small alpine flowering plant)
NTR (site of a famous English racecourse)
questions.explanation:
Aintree & aintree.

	Venue of the annual 'Grand National steeplechase' which has been run since 1839.

questions.text: SCHHRZD (storyteller in 'The Arabian Nights')
CTV (wife of Mark Antony and sister of Augustus)
SSCLS (a triangle having two sides of equal length)
RCHS (a recently extinct member of the cattle tribe)
RDL (a large, rough-haired tan-coloured breed of terrier)
HKH (it was smoked by the caterpillar in 'Alice in Wonderland')
questions.explanation:
Hookah & hookah.

	An oriental pipe for smoking tobacco consisting of one or more long flexible stems connected to a container of water through which smoke is drawn and cooled.

questions.text: MCRN (sweet biscuit made of ground almonds, sugar and egg whites)
ZLS (inspired by intense enthusiasm)
RSL (legendary British princess said to have been martyred together with 11,000 virgins by the Huns at Cologne)
RL (a songbird with mostly yellow and black plumage)
DD (a wild mountain sheep of North Africa)
questions.explanation:
Aoudad & aoudad.

	Hope you enjoyed the more challenging skeleton quiz.
